During cheer camp this week there was a positive case of COVID-19 in Hagerman HS. The following protocol and steps are being exercised beginning Wednesday July 22, 2020:

*All Hagerman cheerleaders who were at the camp are being contacted via parents. They should be quarantined for 14 days and continue to be monitored over the extended period of time.

*All cheer camp coaches are being contacted.

*Hagerman HS will be disinfected beginning Monday, July 27.

*ALL sports practices (football, volleyball, cheer) are postponed until further notice.

*The weightroom will be closed until Tuesday, July 28, but the Prince Gym will be closed until further notice.

*Health Department is being contacted.

If you have any questions, please email Dr. Brown, or Mr. Wadsworth. Thank you.

****HHS/JH GRADING PROCEDURES: Beginning March 30, 2020****

Administrative guidance to staff is to provide content standard work with an emphasis on quality over quantity. Teachers are working hard in these efforts. Hats off to them

Teachers should take 3rd quarter progress reports as the base score, students have the opportunity to improve that score (i.e D to C) yet no student should experience a grade drop off more than one letter grade (i.e C to D). Students with Fs at the end of the 3rd quarter who are not doing the work offered them during the Soft closure still have an F.

Students who are on the verge of failing (D minus) at the 3rd Q and not completing any of the work can fail, or receive an "I". In the interest of sending them on to the next level they would not be prepared.
